text:
Technically we shouldn't use PCA at all because alot of the features are binary - but I am lazy and that's fine for my purposes because I don't need anything out of the analysis. Added a little bit too it last night:
<https://github.com/caseykneale/PickingALanguage2020/tree/main/fieldnotes/analysis>

text: Oh yeah good point on not being able to use PCA on binary features! I wonder what are some good ways to handle dimensionality reduction with binary or categorical features

elements.text: Oh yeah good point on not being able to use PCA on binary features! I wonder what are some good ways to handle dimensionality reduction with binary or categorical features

text:
So likert data, count data, and binary data, technically caaan be used with something like PCA. But... It's not correct right.

There are techniques you can use, typically specialist doohickies, but I'm too lazy to be honest.

Typically people use entropy methods.

I had to do something custom but I don't remember what I did...

attachments.title: princals: Categorical principal component analysis (PRINCALS). in Gifi: Multivariate Analysis with Optimal Scaling
attachments.text: Fits a categorical PCA. The default is to take each input variable as ordinal but it works for mixed scale levels (incl. nominal) as well. Through a proper spline specification various continuous transformation functions can be specified: linear, polynomials, and (monotone) splines.
